channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Beware the Return of Inflation
item.description: The surge in the producer price index is not due to tariffs — which should worry the administration.

item.title: Democrats Don’t Get To Act Thoughtful About Solving The Crime Problem They Created

item.description: The Trump administration, stepping up its crackdown on policing in the nation's capital, on Thursday named the head of the Drug Enforcement Administra...

item.title: Trump Shines a Light on Discrimination in College Admissions
item.description: By forcing schools to open their books, it will be much more difficult for them to rely on application essays and obscure admissions criteria to ‘cove...

item.title: One Big Thing That Critics of Trump’s Move Against D.C. Crime Miss
item.description: It doesn’t matter if the overall crime rate is comparable to that of other cities if it threatens government officials and staffers.

item.title: 'Not welcome here': Staten Island activist arrested after confronting NYC mayoral candidate

item.title: Trump ordered to restore millions in frozen science funding to UCLA
item.description: The school’s chancellor said last week that the Trump administration has pulled $584 million in federal grants from various federal agencies.

item.title: The mighty American consumer keeps shrugging off tariffs as retail sales rise 0.5% in July
item.description: Retail sales rose 0.5% last month, maching economists' estimates.

item.title: The Week: Trump Meets with Putin
item.description: Plus: Remembering Jim Lovell.

item.title: DC sues Trump administration over 'unlawful' federal takeover
item.description: Lawsuit challenges Trump's executive order federalizing D.C. police and Bondi's installation of DEA head as emergency police commissioner as unlawful.

item.title: Abbott, Texas Republicans launch new Trump-backed redistricting push as fleeing Democrats plan to end walkout
item.description: Congressional redistricting battle intensifies as California vows to counter Texas GOP maps while Democratic lawmakers end their walkout protest.

item.title: Americans Who ‘Learned To Code’ At Obama’s Behest Can’t Find Jobs Now
item.description: 'Learn to code' turned out to be one of the most misguided pieces of career advice, and college grads are bearing the brunt of it.

item.title: Bondi puts sanctuary cities nationwide on notice after DC police federal takeover
item.description: The Justice Department sent letters to sanctuary jurisdictions demanding cooperation with immigration enforcement or face legal action in court.

item.title: Michael Saylor bets on a $100 billion Bitcoin ‘credit’ dream
item.description: Michael Saylor, cofounder and executive chairman of Strategy, is asking his loyal following of retail investors to embrace perpetual preferred stocks.

item.title: Steve Jobs’ first Silicon Valley boss turned down an offer to buy a third of Apple for $50,000—today, his share would be worth nearly $1 trillion
item.description: Atari cofounder Nolan Bushnell missed out on becoming a trillionaire because he snubbed an offer from his ex-employee, the late Steve Jobs.

item.title: Taylor Swift’s podcast appearance breaks Trump record, nearly doubling his viewership
item.description: Trump appeared on the Joe Rogan Experience last October.

item.title: Tariffs Won’t Bridge the Fiscal Gap
item.description: With borrowing unleashed, and tariffs offering little more than political cover, Washington is sprinting toward a cliff edge.

item.title: Bombshell DNI Emails Expose Fraud That Sabotaged 2018 Trump-Putin Summit
item.description: The new release by Gabbard is a vindication for Trump, who stood alone in 2018, and strengthens his position ahead of the upcoming summit.

item.title: Election Integrity Activists Hit The Road To Save The SAVE Act
item.description: On Monday, Tea Party Patriots Action will roll out its inaugural Only Citizens Vote Bus Tour, a trek covering more than a dozen states.
